title: Town Amongst Winners of Family Excellence Award - Ipswich Town News
body_text:
Thursday, 8th May 2014 09:48
Town are amongst 47 clubs to have won the Football League’s Family Excellence Award for 2014.
The award was instigated by the Football League in 2007 to recognise “the outstanding experience provided by clubs for young fans and families” with the Blues having secured it for seven successive seasons.
Football League chief executive Shaun Harvey said: "The Football League Family Excellence Award gives clubs a standard to aspire to when planning their efforts to attract more families and young fans to their matches.
"It is hugely encouraging to see so many clubs receiving the accolade, demonstrating The Football League's ongoing commitment to securing the next generation of fans."

Aside from that, it's great to get some recognition for being a proper family club :o)
I couldn't believe it when that fan got moved last week. For throwing the ball with slightly more force than needed to their player? And then the ref got involved? You see things a million times worse in the stands in football and nothing happens, and then a man with his kid does that and gets moved?
How can you equate how a particular type of fan is being catered for, based on the overall attendance? Thats like saying we arent doing enough to encourage ethnic minorities. Or women. Or men.
No comparison today - to what we once were - in so, so many ways.
